N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2007.2 - Remedies

State Regulations

The president shall be empowered at his discretion after
consideration of relevant circumstances and equity with respect to a refund
and/or overpayment owed from a student or institution to: (a) require immediate and full
repayment; (b) accept a repayment
schedule or installment payments over a reasonable period of time; (c) establish an escrow account with
corporation as security for eventual repayment of a liability; (d) reduce any future award received by such
student by the amount of the refund due; (e) reduce any future payments receivable by
the institution on behalf of currently eligible students by the amount of
refund due with the direction to the institution to consider each eligible
student's account to have been credited with the amount of his award
eligibility for that term of attendance; or
(f) immediately, including during the
pendency of any proceeding under section
2007.4
of this Part, and without
prior notice, to suspend all or part of any payments due or payable to an
institution for awards or prepayments thereof until payment of the refund due
has been made or, if applicable, satisfactory repayment arrangements have been
entered into. Written notice of the action shall be transmitted to the
institutions within five days thereof. Notes
